001package ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.buffer;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.io.OutputStream;
005import java.util.Objects;
006
007/**
008 * OutputStream wrapper that buffers writes using a pooled byte array.
009 */
010public final class PooledBufferedOutputStream extends OutputStream {
011  private final OutputStream delegate;
012  private final BufferPool.PooledBuffer pooled;
013  private final byte[] buffer;
014  private int position;
015  private boolean closed;
016
017  /**
018   * Creates a buffered stream using a reusable array from the supplied pool.
019   *
020   * @param delegate downstream stream receiving flushed bytes
021   * @param pool buffer pool providing the backing array
022   */
023  public PooledBufferedOutputStream(OutputStream delegate, BufferPool pool) {
024    this.delegate = Objects.requireNonNull(delegate, "delegate");
025    Objects.requireNonNull(pool, "pool");
026    this.pooled = pool.acquire();
027    this.buffer = pooled.array();
028    this.position = 0;
029  }
030
031  @Override
032  public synchronized void write(int b) throws IOException {
033    ensureOpen();
034    if (position == buffer.length) {
035      flushBuffer();
036    }
037    buffer[position++] = (byte) b;
038  }
039
040  @Override
041  public synchronized void write(byte[] b, int off, int len) throws IOException {
042    ensureOpen();
043    if (len <= 0) {
044      return;
045    }
046    Objects.checkFromIndexSize(off, len, b.length);
047    int remaining = len;
048    int offset = off;
049    while (remaining > 0) {
050      if (position == buffer.length) {
051        flushBuffer();
052      }
053      int chunk = Math.min(buffer.length - position, remaining);
054      System.arraycopy(b, offset, buffer, position, chunk);
055      position += chunk;
056      offset += chunk;
057      remaining -= chunk;
058      if (position == buffer.length) {
059        flushBuffer();
060      }
061    }
062  }
063
064  @Override
065  public synchronized void flush() throws IOException {
066    ensureOpen();
067    flushBuffer();
068    delegate.flush();
069  }
070
071  @Override
072  public synchronized void close() throws IOException {
073    if (closed) {
074      return;
075    }
076    IOException error = null;
077    try {
078      flushBuffer();
079    } catch (IOException flushError) {
080      error = flushError;
081    }
082    try {
083      delegate.close();
084    } catch (IOException closeError) {
085      if (error == null) {
086        error = closeError;
087      }
088    } finally {
089      closed = true;
090      pooled.close();
091    }
092    if (error != null) {
093      throw error;
094    }
095  }
096
097  private void flushBuffer() throws IOException {
098    if (position == 0) {
099      return;
100    }
101    delegate.write(buffer, 0, position);
102    position = 0;
103  }
104
105  private void ensureOpen() {
106    if (closed) {
107      throw new IllegalStateException("stream closed");
108    }
109  }
110}
